data.title: The BEST soup in Sacramento
data.text:
They say great things come in small packages and nothing could be more true about this place. I was introduced to it by one of my co-workers and since then I visit it about 3 times a week. They have a rotating menu that varies based on what is in season. The sandwiches are delicious, my favorite being the Paris Hilton. The soups however, are absolutely a must try! I always order a large with half a baguette. My top faves are the Potato Habanero/Jalapeño Cheddar or the Cream of Mushroom. You can't go wrong with either. 

The place is really small, there's only about five small tables inside and two outside. There's usually only two staff in there, the chef and the cashier - they're both really friendly! This is not the place to go if you're looking for a fancy sit down place, but you just can't go wrong with the food definitely worth the visit.

data.title: Amazing little French-inspired soup and sandwich shop in downtown Sacramento!
data.text:
Overall the food here is excellent, a must to try out if your downtown. I went based on great yelp reviews and was not disappointed. From the outside and inside, looks a little dirty and old, but the food more than makes up for it. The head chef there prepares the food in front of you and it's ready in minutes. Ask him what he recommends that day, but honestly you can't go wrong. Ate there three times while in town on business, having the combo sandwich, soup, and drink combo for about $11. I had the tri tip beef, pork sausage, and crab melt, all excellent, fresh, SUPER tasty. Then I had the seafood soup twice and French onion soup, both awesome. The seafood soup is loaded with seafood, and is like a bisque. You can taste the homemade love in it in the food. Even the bread is delicious, and great for dropping in your soup. I would eat there again any day. Portions are good and the food is so delicious. 

The bathroom situation is a little weird since its in the back down a hallway, and it's shared. I like to to wash my hands before I eat and I hate weird, out of the way, dirty looking bathrooms, so sue me. I knock one star off for that.

Cute little French tunes playing in the background too!

data.title: Unexpected Find in Sacramento
data.text: My wife found La Bonne Soupe Cafe on Yelp with great reviews so we decided to give it a try. Arriving just before noon on a Thursday to what appeared to be a little hole-in-the-wall place on a non-descript block in downtown Sacramento, we found just a few customers eating and no wait. After ordering, we sat at one of the few tables inside and just in time. Suddenly the line was out the door and when our food came we found out why. We shared a sandwich and a soup and both were simply outstanding. The sandwich was literally one of the best I've ever had. It doesn't really matter what kind as all around us regulars were raving about their orders and discussing what they had last time and what they were going to have the next time.  All fresh organic ingredients. Just go and enjoy.

data.title: Best food in town
data.text: I walked by this little gem the first week of my job in May 2015 and was fascinated by the special menu board. 4-5 soups and 4-5 sandwiches. I go once a week now and since Chef Edward continually looks for seasonal ingredients I rarely have the same thing. Every soup I've had there is the best of that variety I've ever tasted.

data.title: Just Go and Eat The Soup
data.text: Magic little place, really small but fantastic soups and sandwiches, very French in character with great bread and appropriate serving sizes.  Hand made sandwiches created with flair, and one of the best bowls of soup I've had in ages.  Plus there was some kind of PA system hooked up to a guitar amp so maybe they do live music sometimes?  Will be back there on my next trip for sure.

data.title: Delightfully Unique
data.text:
We met my wife's brother and his wife for lunch at this small and delightful gem in central downtown Sacramento. Along with a menu of 8 - 10 sandwiches owas n freshly baked bread there are daily specials offered with unique cheese pairings.
Their freshly made soups are rich and delicious. The large bowl compliments their sandwiches well.
We arrived just after opening at 11 am. Within minutes, there was a line going outside that never ended while we were there. They close at 3, and probably stay busy the entire time.

data.title: Fantastic Sandwiches
data.text: If you want to get lunch in Sacramento, go to La Bonne Soupe. The sandwiches are freshly prepared with fresh ingredients. They're a lot different from subway or similar chains. On a sunny day you can walk to the capitol park and enjoy the delicious sandwich there.

data.title: Tasty sandwiches.
data.text: The small restaurant has a variety of sandwiches and soups. The food is good and tasty. The ingredients are natural and fresh. Although the sandwiches are small, it is a great choice for healthy eating.

data.title: Best Onion Soup In Town
data.text:
Went to Le Bonne for lunch with friends, get there early if you’re planning on sitting down because there aren't many tables.
Had the French onion soup which was world class.
Then had a chicken sandwich that was prepared in front to me while I directed the chef to add aioli and oyster mushrooms, it was great too.
The bistro atmosphere is nice for lunch.
Would recommend it to anyone for a nice quick lunch in downtown Sacramento.

data.title: Small Piece of Paris for Sacramento Lunch
data.text:
This bistro type eatery is small, don't blink or you'll miss it.  But you'll also miss one of the best places for a quick and oh-so-flavorful lunch in Sacramento.  In the heart of downtown, it's open weekdays from 11am to 3pm, and some Saturdays. There are usually four or five types of soup on the menu and always one veggie/vegan.  And a list of sandwiches that will make you drool like the duck confit with caramelized onion, field greens and Laura Chenel goat cheese. Or smoked salmon, turkey, lamb, chicken and daily specials, each with their own list of provoking ingredients.  You can also order half a sandwich, nice for a lighter lunch.  There is seating for about eight inside and two tables outside, which usually fill up by noon.  

I suppose if you arrive early enough to snag a table you could enjoy a leisurely lunch.  But it's a great place for take out that satisfies a variety of palates. Yes on espresso and cappuccino, no on alcohol.  They also offer a few desserts and cookies but haven't tried them so cannot comment.
